lexUnit.name: toss.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: jerk (one's head or hair) sharply backwards

sentence.text: When she tossed her head her hair fell around her shoulders and upper arms in a lovely auburn cascade .
She tossed her hair and preened , imitating her mother .
Gay took off her hat , the shapeless school felt that would soon be discarded for ever , and tossed the short straight hair from her broad , clever forehead .
She tossed her luxuriant dark hair , which fell to her waist from a demure white lace cap tied under her chin with a satin bow .
He tossed back his hair and glared down at Rain .
Marianne tossed her long blonde hair contemptuously , and Shae wryly deducted the point .
It was clear she was waging an internal battle with herself , but finally the actress in her won out , and she tossed her luxuriant hair back contemptuously .
Sheila put her glass down and tossed her head .
She laughed prettily and tossed her head , her eyes flashing with amusement .
A horse will register his disgust or irritation by wrinkling his nostrils , tossing his head and swishing his tail .
Paula pursed her lips and tossed her head , looking annoyed .
The chestnut tossed his head and mouthed the bit , but his stride was smooth and easy .
He 'd roll and toss all night with bad dreams and talking .
She could hardly send him away , though Sycorax from the hammock where she lay , surveying the scene , clicked her dry tongue impatiently and tossed about .
They bathed his arm again but with the water of the brook instead of wine , and though this gave him brief ease he was soon moaning and tossing again .
In the beds , children slept , except one who tossed restlessly to and fro .
She had slept badly , tossing and turning in the heat though the room had been cool enough .
